Row.Text: Dutch East India Company

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] International Trade routes provide +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, and +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. Other Civs' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to you provide them with +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for you. +1 Bonus [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.
William of Orange

Hail stalwart Prince William of Orange, liberator of the Netherlands and hero to the Dutch people. It was your courageous effort in the 1568 rebellion against Spanish dominion that led the Dutch to freedom, and ultimately resulted in the Eighty Years' War. Your undertaking allowed for the creation of one of Europe's first modern republics, the Seven United Provinces. You gave your life to the rebellion, falling at the hands of an assassin in 1584, but your death would only serve to embolden the people's charge, and your legacy as "Father of the Fatherland" will stand as a symbol of Dutch independence for all time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Brave prince, the people again yearn for the wise stewardship your wisdom afforded them. Can you once again secure the sovereignty of your kingdom and lead your people to greatness? Can you build a civilization that stands the test of time?
William of Orange
Stadtholder of the provinces of Holland, Zeeland and Utrecht.
Mijn God, mijn God, heb medelijden met mijn ziel en met dit arme volk!

William I, Prince of Orange (24 April 1533 â€“ 10 July 1584), also widely known as William the Silent or William the Taciturn (translated from Dutch: Willem de Zwijger), or more commonly known as William of Orange (Dutch: Willem van Oranje), was the main leader of the Dutch revolt against the Spanish Habsburgs that set off the Eighty Years' War (1568â€“1648) and resulted in the formal independence of the United Provinces in 1581. He was born in the House of Nassau as Count of Nassau-Dillenburg. He became Prince of Orange in 1544 and is thereby the founder of the branch House of Orange-Nassau and the ancestor of the monarchy of the Netherlands. Within the Netherlands he is also known as Father of the Fatherland. (Dutch: Vader des Vaderlands).

A wealthy nobleman, William originally served the Habsburgs as a member of the court of Margaret of Parma, governor of the Spanish Netherlands. Unhappy with the centralisation of political power away from the local estates and with the Spanish persecution of Dutch Protestants, William joined the Dutch uprising and turned against his former masters. The most influential and politically capable of the rebels, he led the Dutch to several successes in the fight against the Spanish. Declared an outlaw by the Spanish king in 1580, he was assassinated by Balthasar GÃ©rard (also written as "Gerardts") in Delft in 1584.
Welcome to the court of William of Orange, father of the Netherlands. Don't just stand there ... what do you want?
What business do you have in the Netherlands - I am William of Orange, its sovereign ruler.
Thank you, friend.
I am William of Orange, of the Netherlands. Did you need something? I'm quite busy.
Until we meet again.
You are too kind, my friend. Your gifts arrived with your trade delegation, and I have personally thanked them.
Unfortunately, no.
I have sent a trade delegation to you with gifts from our land: tulips, little mills, and something to smoke.
We are happy to open up our borders to your units.
We are not interested at this time.
Will you allow our units to cross through your territory?
I accept your offer of friendship. I believe both our peoples may stand to profit from this arrangement.
Not this time, friend. We have our own troubles to deal with.
Come, I believe I have something which will interest you.
Thank you, friend.
... You were serious?
Would you like to form an alliance?
It is sometimes useful to have a strong economy.
Your management is calamitous.
Please, friend, move your soldiers from my borders. They spoil our merchants.
{LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_WILLIAM_OF_ORANGE_ANY}
{LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_WILLIAM_OF_ORANGE_ANY}
You are beginning to remind me of my second wife, and she was quite mad ...
I'm beginning to suspect this is some plot to neutralize me. Go away!. (Denounces You).
You have proven yourself an unfit ruler, and I can bear the cries of your people no longer. They will be liberated from your tyranny.
As much as I hate war, I consider purging your existence a form of community service.
Yes, yes. That is a good thing.
Sorry, but no.
You know what you have done, which has led us to this ... unfortunate turn of events.
Curse you! I had hoped to deliver my people from all foreign yokes, but it seems they shall continue to suffer under yours.
[LOC_DIPLO_DEFEAT_FROM_AI_LEADER_WILLIAM_OF_ORANGE_ANY]
Vader des Vaderlands
Tries to maximize [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. Likes civilizations that trade with her, dislikes those who do not.
The Leader appreciates that your empire trades with its empire.
Le Dirigeant apprÃ©cie que votre empire fasse du commerce avec lui.

Compagnie des Indes Orientales

Vos [ICON_TradeRoute] Routes Commerciales internationales fournissent +2 [ICON_FOOD] Nourriture, +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, et +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. Les [ICON_TradeRoute] Routes Commerciales des autres civilizations vous fournissent +2 [ICON_GOLD] Or et leur fournissent +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. +1 capacitÃ© pour [ICON_TradeRoute] Route Commerciale.
William of Orange

Votre dÃ©termination a donnÃ© naissance Ã l'une des premiÃ¨res rÃ©publiques modernes d'Europe, les sept provinces unies. Vous avez donnÃ© votre vie Ã la rÃ©bellion, avant de tomber victime d'un assassin en 1584, mais votre mort ne fit qu'encourager votre peuple dans la voie que vous lui aviez tracÃ©e, et votre hÃ©ritage, en tant que "pÃ¨re de la patrie", restera Ã jamais synonyme de l'indÃ©pendance nÃ©erlandaise. Prince d'Orange
Comte de Nassau, de Katzenelbogen, de Vianden, burgrave d'Anvers, stathouder de Hollande, de Voorne, de ZÃ©lande, de Frise occidentale et d'Utrecht.
Mon Dieu, mon dieu, ayez pitiÃ© de mon Ã¢me et de ce pauvre peuple!

Guillaume de Nassau, prince d'Orange (en nÃ©erlandais : Willem van Oranje), comte de Nassau, dit Ã©galement Guillaume le Taciturne (Willem de Zwijger) est nÃ© le 24 avril 1533 Ã Dillenburg et mort au Prinsenhof de Delft le 10 juillet 1584, assassinÃ© par Balthazar GÃ©rard. Sa dÃ©pouille repose dans la Nieuwe Kerk de Delft. Il fut prince d'Orange, comte de Nassau Ã partir de 1544, puis de Katzenelbogen, de Vianden, burgrave d'Anvers, stathouder de Hollande, de Voorne, de ZÃ©lande, de Frise occidentale et d'Utrecht Ã partir de 1559, gouvernant un territoire partagÃ© actuellement entre la Belgique et les Pays-Bas.

Ã€ l'origine membre de l'entourage de Charles Quint et fidÃ¨le partisan des Habsbourg, Guillaume d'Orange est surtout connu pour avoir Ã©tÃ© l'initiateur et le chef de la rÃ©volte des Pays-Bas espagnols contre le roi d'Espagne Philippe II, fils de Charles Quint. Cette rÃ©volte entraÃ®na une volontÃ© d'Ã©mancipation des Ã‰tats gÃ©nÃ©raux (gouvernement) qui conduisit Ã l'indÃ©pendance des Pays-Bas du Nord, Provinces-Unies, alors que les Pays-Bas du Sud, la Belgica Regia, retombaient sous la domination espagnole aprÃ¨s la guerre de Quatre-Vingts Ans.
Je suis Guillaume d'Orange, prince des Pays-Bas. Vous aviez besoin de quelque chose ? Je suis assez occupÃ©.
Bienvenue Ã la cour de Guillaume d'Orange, pÃ¨re des Pays-Bas. Ne restez pas lÃ les bras ballants... Que voulez-vousÂ ?
Je vous remercie.
J'aime voyager et je visiterai peut-Ãªtre un jour votre capitale. Est-elle loin d'iciÂ ? Que pouvez-vous m'en direÂ ?
Que faites-vous au juste aux Pays-Bas ? Je suis Guillaume d'Orange, le souverain.
C'est trop aimable. Vos prÃ©sents sont arrivÃ©s avec votre dÃ©lÃ©gation, je les ai personnellement remerciÃ©s.
Non, malheureusement.
Je vous envoie une dÃ©lÃ©gation commerciale avec des cadeaux de mon paysÂ : des tulipes, des petits moulins et de quoi fumer.
C'est avec plaisir que nous ouvrons nos frontiÃ¨res Ã vos unitÃ©s.
Nous ne sommes pas intÃ©ressÃ©s pour l'instant.

J'accepte votre offre d'amitiÃ©.
Pas cette fois. Nous avons nous aussi des choses qui nous prÃ©occupent.

C'est malencontreux.
Aimeriez-vous former une alliance?
Une Ã©conomie florissante? Cela peut toujours servir figurez-vous!
Vous semblez connaÃ®tre quelques difficultÃ©s, non?

Vous savez bien ce qui nous a conduits Ã cette... fÃ¢cheuse tournure des Ã©vÃ©nements.
Ce mÃ©pris total pour toute vie humaine ne sera pas tolÃ©rÃ©. (DÃ©nonciation)
Vous avez prouvÃ© que vous Ã©tiez un dirigeant inapte, et je ne peux plus supporter les cris de votre peuple. Il sera libÃ©rÃ© de votre tyrannie.
Bien que je dÃ©teste la guerre, je considÃ¨re que dÃ©barrasser le monde de votre prÃ©sence est un service rendu Ã l'humanitÃ© entiÃ¨re.
Oui, oui. C'est une bonne chose.
Quelle perte de temps!
Il me semble qu'il est temps de faire la paix.
Peut-Ãªtre que c'est mieux ainsi... Maintenant, au moins, je n'aurai pas Ã vous regarder dÃ©truire ma nation bien-aimÃ©e.
